basics.name: Christopher Nguyen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: ALOHA! My name is Christopher Nguyen from Honolulu, Hawaii. I am a third-year Computer Science student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Business Administration.

highlights: Used open-source software and seven Raspberry Pis to created an automated 72-inch video wall system
Conducted high level network assessments for external clients and state agencies
Developed the website for Ditto, a social media startup in the Blue Startups Accelerator Program
Conducted extensive consumer research using AB testing and Google Analytics of user behavior
Customized a mobile geographic information system (GIS) application that reduced the damage assessment time of disaster response units by 40% (4-5 hours) using the ArcGIS API
Developed a cross-platform Customer Relationship Management (CRM) mobile application using the Cordova framework to increase client and consultant interaction by 10%
Collaborated with 28 schools in the Kaimuki-McKinley-Roosevelt Complex Area to develop a 21st-century STEM curriculum that sparked a 48% STEM interest
Mentored students in the Honolulu District and Hawaii State Science and Engineer Fair that totalled $15,000+ in awards from Chevron, IEEE, Intel and more

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
